name: Spicy Balsamic Tomato Salad
author: stronglive1
summary: This salad goes well with both Mexican/Latin American food and Italian/Mediterranean food.  It bursts with balsamic-ginger spiciness, tomato sweetness, and chayote cooling.
ingredients: ½ pound tomatoes, cut into thin wedges
2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, or more if needed
2 tablespoons rice vinegar, or more if needed
1 teaspoon dried basil, or to taste
¼ teaspoon ground ginger, or to taste
1 ¼ pounds chayote squash, thinly sliced
directions: Place tomatoes in a large bowl; add equal amounts balsamic vinegar and rice vinegar until tomatoes are covered
Season with basil and ginger; stir
Let sit, stirring every 15, until flavors, combine, about 1 hour
Drain off any excess liquid from the tomatoes, reserving the vinegar mixture
Combine tomatoes and chayote and serve with vinegar mixture as the dressing
